dcterms:creator: R. J. Baxter
dcterms:description: The Ising model is a mathematical model of ferromagnetism in statistical mechanics, where each site has a spin that can be either up or down, and interactions between neighboring spins influence the overall magnetic behavior of the system.
dcterms:title: Ising model

dcterms:creator: W. W. Zachary
dcterms:description: The Karate Club graph represents the friendships among members of a university karate club, which later split into two factions, making it a classic example for community detection in networks.
dcterms:title: Karate Club graph

dcterms:creator: P. W. Holland
K. B. Laskey
S. Leinhardt
dcterms:description: The Stochastic Block Model (SBM) is a generative model used for community detection in networks, where nodes are assigned to communities and edges are formed based on community membership.
dcterms:title: Stochastic Block Model (SBM)

dcterms:creator: G. Brightwell
P. Winkler
dcterms:description: This dataset involves ranking from noisy comparisons, where the goal is to infer the underlying ranks of objects based on pairwise comparisons that may contain noise.
dcterms:title: Ranking from noisy comparisons
